summary: This is an email press release from ECPAT-USA responding to the sentencing of Ghislaine Maxwell to 20 years in prison. The organization expresses gratitude to prosecutors, investigators, jurors, and survivors, and calls for continued investigation of child exploitation crimes.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Sentenced to 20 years in prison for her role in enabling Jeffrey Epstein's crimes against children.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as the central figure whose crimes against children Maxwell enabled.

persons.name: Lori L. Cohen
persons.context: Quoted in the press release commenting on the significance of Maxwell's sentencing and the need for accountability.

connections.description: Maxwell enabled Epstein's web of crimes against children, as stated in the sentencing context.
Maxwell is described as enabling Epstein's abuse of children, positioning her as a perpetrator alongside him.

events.title: Sentencing of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was sentenced to 20 years in prison for her role in enabling Jeffrey Epstein's crimes against children.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was sentenced to 20 years in prison for enabling Jeffrey Epstein's crimes against children.
The sentencing is framed as about accountability for victims and all children at risk of exploitation.
ECPAT-USA calls for government officials to prioritize investigating and prosecuting child exploitation crimes.
The document references a 'network of co-conspirators' beyond Maxwell and Epstein.
The organization's mission is to end commercial sexual exploitation of children through policy and legislation.
